page.title: 06Tourism In Jedburgh
page.content: The Tourist Information Centre is situated on the A68 beside a large car park.We have many historical buildings.There is the Abbey built in the 12th.Cen.We also have the Castle Jail and Mary Queen of Scots'house.The Capon Tree and the Bridewell Jail are also of interest.There is a town trail, four parks,a swimming pool, sports centre and trout fishing along the River Jed.The Canongate Gallery, in addition to paintings sells craft goods.We have antique shops,gift shops and attractive award-winning buildings."Jethart Snails"and knitwear make fine souvenirs.Places for eating include the Carters'Rest,the Copper Kettle and several cafes too.There are hotels,guest houses and B&B accommodation.Jedburgh is situated in beautiful Border countryside.
